articles.headline: A California Land Mystery Is Solved. Now the Political Fight Begins.
articles.snippet: Tech industry investors spent roughly $900 million buying land to build a dream city in a rural part of the Bay Area. It could be years, though, before they can do anything with it.
articles.abstract: Tech industry investors spent roughly $900 million buying land to build a dream city in a rural part of the Bay Area. It could be years, though, before they can do anything with it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jan Sramek was 15 years old the first time he tried to get a government to do something he wanted. Back then, he was an internet- and science fiction-obsessed teenager growing up in Drevohostice, in the Czech Republic.
articles.byline: By Conor Dougherty and Shawn Hubler

articles.headline: After Losing Their Homes, Lahaina Parents Try to Save Their School Community
articles.snippet: Nearly 60 percent of Lahaina students haven’t enrolled in classes after the deadly fire, and families are yearning to rebuild their school network for educational and emotional support.
articles.abstract: Nearly 60 percent of Lahaina students haven’t enrolled in classes after the deadly fire, and families are yearning to rebuild their school network for educational and emotional support.
articles.lead_paragraph: The flames that ripped through Lahaina needed only a few hours to take nearly everything from Aina Kohler. Her house. Her surfing school and cafe. And her parents’ home, where she was raised.

articles.headline: Falsehoods Follow Close Behind This Summer’s Natural Disasters
articles.snippet: Misattributed videos, recycled lies and warped fears are fueling unfounded claims about the recent record-breaking heat, floods and wildfires.
articles.abstract: Misattributed videos, recycled lies and warped fears are fueling unfounded claims about the recent record-breaking heat, floods and wildfires.
articles.lead_paragraph: As natural disasters and extreme environmental conditions became more commonplace around the world this summer, scientists pointed repeatedly to a shared driver: climate change.

articles.headline: Mark Thompson Helped Steady 2 News Outlets. Can He Do the Same at CNN?
articles.snippet: Mr. Thompson, who oversaw a period of growth at The New York Times and the BBC, will lead the network during a pivotal period.
articles.abstract: Mr. Thompson, who oversaw a period of growth at The New York Times and the BBC, will lead the network during a pivotal period.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mark Thompson, a former top executive at The New York Times Company and the BBC, was touring wine country in the south of France with his wife in mid-June when an unexpected call came in.
articles.byline: By John Koblin, Benjamin Mullin and Katie Robertson

articles.headline: Inflation Has Been Easing Fast, but Wild Cards Lie Ahead
articles.snippet: Will inflation continue to slow at a solid pace? Economists are warily watching a few key areas, like housing and cars.
articles.abstract: Will inflation continue to slow at a solid pace? Economists are warily watching a few key areas, like housing and cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden has openly celebrated recent inflation reports, and Federal Reserve officials have also breathed a sigh of relief as rapid price gains show signs of losing steam.

articles.headline: Decades After Dictatorship, Chile Mounts Search for Hundreds Who Vanished
articles.snippet: President Gabriel Boric authorized a new national search plan ahead of the 50th anniversary of the coup that toppled the government and led to the disappearance and killing of thousands.
articles.abstract: President Gabriel Boric authorized a new national search plan ahead of the 50th anniversary of the coup that toppled the government and led to the disappearance and killing of thousands.
articles.lead_paragraph: Thirty-six years after Fernando Ortíz’s abduction and disappearance, his family finally received his remains: five bone fragments in a box.

articles.headline: Labor Dept. Proposes Vast Expansion of Overtime Eligibility
articles.snippet: The Biden administration seeks a threshold of about $55,000 in annual pay under which salaried workers must receive overtime, up from $35,500.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration seeks a threshold of about $55,000 in annual pay under which salaried workers must receive overtime, up from $35,500.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a move that could affect millions of workers, the Biden administration announced Wednesday that it was proposing to substantially increase the cutoff below which most salaried workers automatically receive time-and-a-half overtime pay.
